subject: Web3
title: The QuadrigaCX Mystery
description: A short lesson to help you apply The QuadrigaCX Mystery.

hook.text: When the CEO of Canada's largest crypto exchange died, he took $190 million in customer funds to his grave.

buildup.text: Gerald Cotten died in India in 2018. He was the only person with the private keys to the exchange's cold wallets.

discovery.text: Investigators found most of the wallets had been emptied long before his death. The funds were already gone.

twist.text: Many customers believe Cotten faked his death and fled with the money. His body was exhumed but confirmed his identity.

climax.text: Whether it was fraud or catastrophic mismanagement, customers lost everything. Single points of failure are lethal.

punchline.text: One man held all the keys. When he died, the money vanished.

quiz.question: What happened to QuadrigaCX customer funds?
options: The CEO died with the only private keys, and wallets were already empty
They were frozen by the government
